title: Business & Finance
text:
The Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq closed at records Friday, notching gains of 1.6%, 1.8% and 2.4%, respectively, for the first week of the year.

---

The NFL will allow CBS, NBC and Fox to sell an additional two minutes of commercials during the playoff games leading up to the Super Bowl.

---

U.K. antitrust officials are investigating whether Google's plan to remove some user-tracking tools from its Chrome browser could hurt competition in the online-advertising industry.

---

Acacia is scrapping a plan to sell itself to Cisco for roughly $2.6 billion, though the networking-equipment giant is aiming to muscle its way to completing the deal.

---

Deutsche Bank will pay $130 million largely to settle allegations that it violated bribery laws.

---

Roku agreed to acquire the rights to content from Quibi, the defunct short-form streaming service.
